title: Possible Sona buffs that'd actually make sense
body:
1) Make her heal/shield either a full shield or a full heal. No more 50/50 shit. People don't understand the best means of using Sona's W because of this needlessly complicated implication of it (Right now, it's better as an over-healing shield than it is a heal until level 13 at mid-late game, then it's a decent heal with a shield tacked onto it.).

2) Make her shield last longer than 1.5 seconds. The duration on the shield is stupidly low. Maybe an extra second? 2.0 - 2.5 seconds isn't that bad.

3) Allow E to boost ally attack speed

4) Allow E to give Sona an enhanced AA that can sort of slow enemies without having to be on her 3rd shot (so similar to Q but without the extra blue attack thingies). The slow can be half the value of the Power Chord version's.

Don't have to do ALL these things, but at least some of them could be decent buffs to the champ without touching her damage. Thoughts?

replies.body:
Or stop making her have everything and just give her specific strengths.

I don't get the shield addition when she could have just a better heal, I don't get the high ass poke damage she gets when she should be a champion centered around buffing her team.

There kits aren't similar enough to where they could have the same playstyle.

Janna is a defensive support better for peeling with her tornado and ult.

Sona works best as a back line healer and aura buff for her team mates, ulting when anyone breaks the front line.

In the lane she should be a sustained lane not a poke lane.

As far as I can tell from the past 2 years of seeing Sona mains talk about her, this is generally a good playstyle for her.

-Edited for clarity.

> In the lane she should be a sustained lane not a poke lane.

Her heal costs more at level 1 than Hymn of Valor at level 3, she's a  poke support with some sustain, similar to Taric being an all in support with some sustain. If you're looking for a sustain lane with some poke, Soraka is a better example.

>In the lane she should be a sustained lane not a poke lane.

It's more both.

Sustain by itself is kind of worthless, you need something to help deter trades otherwise you just wind up taking more damage than you can actually sustain through. Soraka is the exception to this where if she was balanced correctly she'd be able to function off of pure sustain just because it's so high and you can outsustain a trade.

That means on top of sustain you either need either good CC or good damage to help in trades. Good CC isn't exactly a good option for Sona (and we have one already {{champion:267}})  so that kind of just leaves decent damage.

You could theoretically load Sona's auras to output damage but then you run into the problem of balancing auras for the lane and teamfight case. Your auras are potentially two and a half times more powerful in teamfights and depending on how worthless Sona becomes as a champ and not an aura it could just be four times more powerful.

Plus there's the fact that by now Sona's poke is part of her identity, perhaps even more so than her sustain. In season two I can remember Sona being the queen of poke but she's never been the queen of sustain, that's always been Soraka.

Poke is an identity added that no one likes on her, not Sona mains and not the people playing against her. And it's sooooo easy to take out from her kit.

Full sustain lanes work fine with long ranged marksmen or anyone going for a safer lane phase, and having 1 support for everything is dumb and why people complain about Thresh being jack of all trades, Sona brings things to the sustain area that Soraka doesn't like more reliable CC with her ult, and what could be a 2 person better heal, along with Aura buffs for movement speed and maybe they can give her an aura for some attack speed. 

Damage isn't working on Sona because you can't dodge the high damage she deals forcing her to be as gimped as she is currently, short range be damned.
No, actually, I really like playing poke Sona. But thanks for putting words in my mouth.

W is her biggest problem.  It is too expensive for it's effect.  You need to wait until level 16 just to make it viable as a mini {{item:3190}} active (which at lvl 16 her W is still technically weaker but with a lower CD).  

80 mana at level 1 and why doesn't it heal the 2 most damaged champions instead of herself and 1 most damaged champion?  

Why does it shield damage but the heal scales on missing %HP?  Isn't a shield supposed to prevent damage, but then this heal want your target to have more damage (I'm confused)?  

That's too outrageous even in Taric's eyes (Just check his heal value and mana costs).  I did a post on my idea about changing her W to make it's power more in line with it's cost.

Check it out: [Link](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/89gNfVbv-sona-w-change)

Here's what I think should be done to her. 

https://embed.gyazo.com/c84de56aa4d9356303c9bd64db752e7f.png

People keep saying "Make is a skillshot" but how would you make it a skillshot? It fires two things. If we just alter the projectile itself, then we're still left with the actual hard hitting part. Your options are:

Setting up a pix like situation, making it a cone, or a set "These things go here (like Ashe's Volley)", or making it one projectile. If it's one projectile, chances are that the damage will be combined, making the projectile hurt, and because it can miss it will most likely take some additional power. If you take these into account, the damage will most likely go up (or the range), you'll be hit with the AA + damage buff + potential passive. With this, she'll push more people out of lane unless she's bad (which will probably happen until her mains get used to her, cause most of them will stay with her).  This isn't a good change unless you just straight up plan on nerfing her (which is an option).

To me, if you were going to change her Q to a skillshot, you might as well go through another rework with Sona and rearrange her power so it doesn't feel like it's all stuffed into her Q and R.

If you want to buff Sona as is, I, personally, say remove the AP scaling on her E and give it better per level scaling, cause right now she gets 1% a level and it doesn't even feel good to level when you're forced to. That and a slight tap on the W mana cost, 10 mana at most.

>People keep saying "Make is a skillshot" but how would you make it a skillshot? It fires two things. 

Maybe sounds a bit weird, but Vel'koz it. 

Allow Sona to store two stacks of Q, that way you don't increase the damage of the single projectile and you create more combos for Sona players to use.

Eh, her passive is something I take issue with. The different cooldowns for abilities makes it fairly hard to take advantage of the different passive bonuses, which is kind of upsetting. They used to all be fairly low, so if you wanted a W -> PassiveAA it didn't feel like you were purposefully not using the skill to shoot it out.

I'd much rather have a bunch of low cooldowns and use her passive better than the otherway around. It feels like 90% of the time I'm just using Q -> PassiveAA unless the brewing teamfight is 15 seconds away and I can make use of picking which one I want to lead the fight with.

How to make Sona better without breaking her:

Decrease the downtime between abilities so Sona's more interesting to play. 
Nerf her Q's damage, make the aura part of it last a bit longer. 
Increase W's base heal, remove the shield from healing target unless they are already at full health. (keep it on others in aura range). 

That's it. She should be an Aura based support champion... this is her identity.

You can't remove the shield from the healed targets because she'd never get a shield herself + she's always in the range of her shield. This change'd make no sense because there'd be two conflicting instances for when you'd use W: Some people would block damage and some others would heal damage.

Q's damage is already tied for the lowest base damage on a spell in the entire support class.  If it was nerfed any more, even by 1 point, it would be outclassed by literally EVERY SINGLE damage spell on support champions.

3. Her Q can be given the same sort of treatment I guess, but it's the most satisfying ability in her kit. I don't think it needs any more boosts.
